ratings.comment: I took both AAE215 and 419 with him. He is a nice, kind old man. Huge badger fan. 215 was very easy. As long as you go over the lecture notes and some questions on the book, you will be fine. 419 is harder and small class. His lecture notes for that class were nothing so do need to go to lecture. 6 quizzes, no midterm. Can take cheat sheet to final
He's a very good and clear lecturer. Discussion is optional but you get 5% extra credit from it so it's worth going to! He knows what he's talking about.

Exams were incredibly straightforward and you also get notecards too.  Professor Jones is very passionate about what he teaches, and while the subject material isn't the most interesting, it's still nevertheless a very easy "A".

Great professor, good class. Econ isn't my strong point, but his class made it interesting. I didn't mind studying for tests, although I struggled with them a bit. I'm happy with this class as a whole!
He is very funny and is amazing at making econ, usually a boring subject, interesting and relateable. The tests are tough if you do not pay attention in lecture, but you do get a note card.

Dr. Jones is once of "life's gems," a professor who is both very knowledgable and a good teacher.  He truly  cares for his students and brings real world examples into the classroom.  His teaching prepare students for a successful career.

Really great professor overall. He obviously is passionate about what he teaches which helps a lot. Discussion section participation is extra credit and then rest of your grade is 3 exams. Exams aren't too hard as long as you study - you also get a notecard.

My favorite professor. Very clear in class with many real life examples. Try to make the course interesting. Discussion is optional, exams are multiple choices and T/F, if you concentrate in class, you will do fine.

He was really well informed on everything.  Tests were hard - definitely utilize your cheat sheet.  He was really big on "application" rather than just knowing definitions. Discussion wasn't mandatory to attend, but I definitely recommend going (saved my grade)!

One of the only professor than genuinely cares about his students. Would highly recommend him as a teacher. Textbook is great. Lectures are decent and you can tell he tries to make them interesting and funny.

Professor Jones is very passionate about the subject and  teaching. Very engaging lectures. I would recommend him for both AAE 215 and 419.  One of the best professors I have ever had in my college career!

Great course with a great professor.  Incredibly engaging and interesting lecturer who shows his passion for economics and agriculture.  Never a boring class. Fair grader who gives extra credit for attending discussion.  Curve is a hard A, but most of the class gets ABs and Bs.  Take him for 215.
This is an interesting class, and I would recommend it to anyone.  Bruce is a great professor and clearly enjoys teaching.

Just going to class works for most, but the book can be a helpful compliment to the lectures. Bruce is a really engaging and interesting lecturer and class is usually pretty fun and interesting. Grading curve makes As pretty hard to get, but almost everyone gets an AB or B. Also, you get extra credit just for going to discussion!

great teacher, very good at helping the students understand and accommodating by posting power-points and option book problems' answer sets online. extremely generous curve (nearly everyone got a B or above). half sheets of paper for every exam. only downside is your only grades are the 3 exams. pay attention and read, and you'll learn everything

He was really good at lecturing, definitely kept you awake. His first two exams were really easy, but his final was stupid because some questions were repeated up to 3 times and if you didn't know you were screwed. Also, some questions were very unclear. Overall though, a good easy class. Grading scale makes a B super easy, but an A pretty tough.
He is very helpful. He has alot of energy when lecturing which helps with a boring topic. Great Proff.
